---
title: "redis-username.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML configuration file defines settings for a cache system using Redis as the backend. It specifies cache enablement, backend type, time-to-live (TTL), and Redis connection details including username and password.

## Symbols

### `cache`
#### Description
The root configuration object for the cache system.

#### Internal Logic
- Enables the cache system
- Specifies Redis as the backend
- Sets a TTL of 60 seconds
- Provides Redis connection details

### `cache.enabled`
#### Description
A boolean flag to enable or disable the cache system.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| enabled | boolean | Whether the cache is enabled |

### `cache.backend`
#### Description
Specifies the type of cache backend to use.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| backend | string | The cache backend type (set to "redis") |

### `cache.ttl`
#### Description
Defines the Time-To-Live (TTL) for cached items.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| ttl | duration | The TTL for cached items (set to 60 seconds) |

### `cache.redis`
#### Description
Configuration object for Redis connection details.

#### Internal Logic
- Specifies the username for Redis authentication
- Provides the password for Redis authentication

### `cache.redis.username`
#### Description
The username for authenticating with the Redis server.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| username | string | The Redis username (set to "app") |

### `cache.redis.password`
#### Description
The password for authenticating with the Redis server.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| password | string | The Redis password (set to "s3cr3t!") |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| cache.enabled | boolean | true | Enables or disables the cache system |
| cache.backend | string | "redis" | Specifies the cache backend type |
| cache.ttl | duration | 60s | Sets the Time-To-Live for cached items |
| cache.redis.username | string | "app" | The username for Redis authentication |
| cache.redis.password | string | "s3cr3t!" | The password for Redis authentication |

## Security Considerations
Note that storing passwords in plain text in configuration files is generally not recommended for production environments. In a real-world scenario, it would be advisable to use environment variables, secure vaults, or other secure methods to manage sensitive information like passwords.
